object - a representation of a real world thing in your code

instantiation - the act of creating an instance of a class

Objects have:
    1:State - the collection of attributes associated with the object
    2:Behavior - the collection of actions the object can perform

collective, the state and behavior are reffered to as members of the class

Instance variables - variables that belong to a specific instance

class variables - variables that belong to the class (same for all instances)

constructor - the method (function) that initializes an instance

magic Functions/Dunder methods - python's functions that start and end with double underscores

Dot operator - ued to access the attributes and methods of an object or class
